newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgarian president asks Socialists to form cabinet.
newsitem.headline: Bulgarian president asks Socialists to form cabinet.

text.p: Bulgarian President Petar Stoyanov on Tuesday asked the Socialist Party to form a new government, Interior Minister Nikolai Dobrev said.
Dobrev said the Socialists would accept, despite Stoyanov's appeal on Monday that they refuse a mandate and agree to early elections.
Dobrev, the Socialists' nominee for premier, was jeered by a crowd of about 100 protesters outside the presidency.
He said he had sympathy for daily mass protest rallies and planned a cabinet of non-party technocrats to bring the country out of severe economic crisis.
"I extend my hand to all Bulgarians, to all political forces, and I insist that together we should work out an anti-crisis programme," Dobrev told reporters.
Parliament must approve the new cabinet, which replaces that of Socialist prime minister Zhan Videnov who resigned on December 21.
